review_text: This thing is awesome! I usually use it for jetlags. When it's late at night and I don't feel sleepy, then I would take an hour before I should sleep. And I would usually sleep better through the night. It reccommends 3 gummies (3g melatonin) for adults, but I usually adjust it to 1-3 depending on how not-sleepy I am before I'm supposed to sleep ;) I recently told my mom about it because her body clock always wakes up around 5am whether or not she should rest more because of a very long and tiring day. She's in her 60s and typically sensitive to medication (and caffeine -- she can't sleep if she drinks coffee in the afternoon :O), so she only took 2 gummies. She could sleep to 7am and still sleepy when she awoke. But then she's a bit groggy during the day. But, she likes this much and thinks she'd probably just take 1 gummy next time. Placebo? Maybe, but as long as it works that's all I care ;) because it tastes good, too. Chewy and sweet like Haribo gummy bears unlike the Zarbee's multi-vit which is more on the sour side and less chewy.

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: This review pertains to my child only. I work the midnight shift so it was imperative for me to get him down by 2030 so I could catch a nap from 2100 to 2300. That was NOT happening. On my way to work, I kept hearing about Nyquil Z's for kids. Looked it up, did some research and comparing with Walmart and Amazon when I came across the Zarbee's brand. I disregarded the other brand and immediately put this in my cart as we use Zarbee's for their rub, cough medicine, etc., big fan to say the least. Read the reviews and excitedly waited for my package. Took the advice of a few mothers and only gave him 1/2 a gummy. Gave it to him at 1915 during his bath and followed routine. He was in bed by 1930, bit didn't fall asleep until 1950. Following night, same routine, but gave him 1/2 a gummy at beginning of bath at 1900. In bed by 1930, only got through 3 books and out by 1945. 3rd night, same routine, in bed by 1930 and rolled over to go to sleep only half way through one book. Before, it was at least 8 books, prayers, ocean sounds, with him still running out of the room and me chasing him back. Now, I have time to watch a little t.v. before bed and make lunch all before my 2100 nap before work. Now, for the best part. Didn't want to give my child something I wouldn't try. I'm a light sleeper and was averaging 2-3 hours of sleep a day! Tried one and my first nap afyer work was 4 hours (usually 2) and my galaxy active recorded more REM and deep sleep than before! Did NOT take another for second nap as I was afraid I'd slumber too well. Regardless, the one from earlier still allowed me to fall fast asleep from 2100 to 2300 (usually ends up only 30 min). I was in AWE! I woke up refreshed and ready to go after both naps. Oh and they are quite tasty I might add. LOVE THIS PRODUCT and mind you, I don't write reviews.

review_text: I think it definitely puts you to sleep, if you actually acknowledge that it is in fact making you sleepy. If you're just scrolling through your phone and intentionally disrupting your sleep cycle furthermore - it's not going to do the job. But if for instance, you put your phone away and close your eyes for a second. Bam. It will put you into a coma-like state with no recollection of how this little gummy was able to knock you out like that. But disclaimer!!! this gummy is definitely trespassing beyond its periscope; for instance I start to feel super sleepy exactly 12-18 hours after taking the gummy. Like holy cow, I could sleep like I haven't slept in a while. And I am the sort of person who's always on the go! So that's something you should definitely keep in mind. I think if it were up to me, I would not give this to my kid. I am whole grown adult, if it can have this effect on me, it will surely have a less than favorable impact on a tiny human. Also I haven't exactly read the description, but it does mention "natural". I think the word "natural" is the biggest hoax of all time. Just because something may or may not be natural does not mean it's harmless, I think thats pure ignorance. But does this gummy do the job? Heck yeah. I first started with two gummies cos one wasn't doing the job. But eventually one should do the job.

review_text: My daughter is almost 5. She has had difficulty falling asleep for a couple of years (pre that she was a toddler so it was hit or miss). Someone mentioned to me that some kids (particularly those with adhd) can have low melatonin levels (I have adhd and it’s very hereditary) and it got we thinking that her being wide awake sometimes at 11pm might be a medical issue not a behavioral issue (e.g she misses us or fomo). I took the advice of other reviews and gave her quarter of a gummy (0.25mg). Well it’s been 10 days as she has gone straight to sleep every night! She even asks to go to bed once it kicks in (average an hour). For now I feel the benefits of solid sleep for her and some sanity for the rest of the family are worth it!!

review_text: We have been having a very difficult time getting our 3 year old daughter to sleep at night. We have the same routine each night, but for whatever reason, she has been refusing to actually fall asleep until past 9pm on most nights. product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: We have a 3y4m girl who never went to sleep on her own and I can count on fingers of both hands the number of nights she slept through. I usually go through from 30 minutes to 1.5 hours (lately) of comforting, lullabies, hugs and negotiations. It is exhausting because I have to do this on top of 24/7 parenting and there is nothing I can do about it. I am a preferred parent, she won’t go to bed with anyone else and you can judge me all you want but we parent gently and we believe that she does not owe us anything, she’s not a dog and doesn’t have to cry herself to sleep because this is not what she deserves. However when recently my eye twitch just wouldn’t stop and school was coming I decided to try supplements. Today we were up at 6:45 and had some quiet time through the day but no naps. Long outside play in the morning (3+hrs), painting and modeling, some cartoons, another walk (1hr). At 8 pm she is sitting on the couch telling me that she is tired and needs to go to bed. These are the last words she could ever say. I pick her up wrapped in her blanket, carry her upstairs and by the time I gently put her down I realize she is asleep. I know we are all different but it just feels so weird to me and not only because my selfishness is celebrating but also because my child got what she needs - a peaceful sleep without the unnecessary fighting. It feels so good. It might not be new because melatonin has been around for a while but this is such a big help with what I do every single day. The ingredients and the presentation is also great - honey instead of corn syrup, small sized cute looking gummies and nice taste without chemical yuck. I am beyond pleased. I subscribed to this product and I hope that if you are also a parent of a high energy strong willed child then you will, too. Thanks for reading.
review_header: Parents of fussy kids please read.

review_text: These almost work too good! My child wants to go to bed instead of running around, being crazy and crying when we leave at bedtime. 20 minutes after taking she is asking to go to sleep! Couple things to note...the 1mg dose is WAY too high for a small child. I took one and I was knocked out after 20 min. I cut all them in half and that does the job for my 3 yr old. I did experience a weird feeling in my head and my body was pretty limp with a whole gummy. Didn’t experience this with a half. Also, I got a little stuffiness in my nose before bed. I notice my daughter sometimes is stuffy as well. They are coated in sugar, so my other daughter wouldn’t take it. They taste really good, kind of a banana fruit flavor. These have been a bedtime game changer. I switched to tasteless powder melatonin for my other child that won’t take these, they are only 0.3mg and work just as well.

review_text: The media could not be loaded. I started out using these melatonin gummy’s when my daughter was about 12 months, and I would cut each gummy into six pieces and give a small piece each evening. As she’s gotten older, I have made peace is a little bit bigger. Going from 4 pieces per gummy to now cutting them in half. She is now three years old, and I give her half of the gummy each evening. It naturally helps childen to fall asleep , it is a wonderful product!! Our body naturally produces melatonin on its own so you do not want to over use it, but it given in small amounts this helps the child to just relax enough to fall asleep. Don’t think that this is a sleeping pill - because if for any reason she’s overstimulated or daddy comes in and wants to play with her, then she is not going to be sleepy any longer but wide awake and ready to play! But in general, this is an amazing product and helps to wind the children down enough that her body can relax naturally, and you can have a restful night sleep along with your children.

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: I bought these from Target after reading reviews on Amazon...I had zero hope they would work. My daughter just turned 2 but she's over 35lbs so I assumed it would be alright for 1 gummy...let me tell you what miracle workers these things are! My daughter would be so difficult to get to sleep, she literally would have us up until 4AM every night because she would wire herself out and refuse to sleep. Nothing worked, doesn't matter how early she got up, taking her nap away, giving her a good nap, whatever, nothing worked she was a fight every night!! She would take hours to fall asleep but once she's out she'll sleep for 12 hours no problem. So I got these at my wit's end. First night she was asleep by 10:30PM, which was significantly better considering. I've used them for 3 nights, and they've worked anywhere from 20-45 minutes after giving it to her. I give one to her after her nightly tub and she happily asks for one, then she settles down and has even tucked herself into bed. Whereas normally she would be bouncing off the walls not calming down at all after her tub. It doesn't knock her out, but you can clearly tell it helps calm her down and get her tired when she should be getting tired now. These things are great, and I'm so happy they worked for us!

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: My 3 old boy is extremely energetic/hyper. Especially at night when it’s time to calm down. We have a consistent routine, but he is constantly climbing, jumping, shouting, dancing, playing. Even when lying down, he is still awake for at least an hour to an hour and a half every night. Once he is asleep, he usually does very well throughout the night. Occasionally wakes up, maybe go to the bathroom, then back to sleep. It’s just the initial going to sleep part we wanted help with. We bought these Zarbee’s melatonin gummies with limited expectations. Based on another reviewer’s recommendation, we cut the gummy and gave him just half the first night about an hour before bedtime. At story time, I lay down in his bed to read. With a relaxed sigh, he put his head on my shoulder and said, “It’s nap time.” I couldn’t believe it! He actually lay there still and calmly looked at the book as I was reading. This never happens. After the book and prayer time, I gently left him sleepily lying there. He didn’t get up! I was sold and told my wife the amazing news. These things actually do what they say they do! Here’s the kicker: a couple hours later, my boy started screaming. He wasn’t in pain, but was clearly upset. It took a while, but I was able to console him and he went back to sleep. Maybe a nightmare? Then, a couple hours later, more screaming. This happened a few times throughout the night. He went back to sleep each time, but this was not normal behavior. In the morning, he seemed pretty normal. Even though we only gave him half a gummy, we thought maybe the dosage was still too high for our little guy. The next night, we gave him just one fourth (!) of a gummy. Again, he went to sleep calmly and quickly. Nice! However, there was some more disturbance during the night. And this time, he also wet the bed. Not normally a big deal, only this was the first time he had wet the bed in several months. That was when my wife and I thought that - for our son - the cons outweighed the benefits. Idk if others have experienced these or similar side effects. I’m aware that I’m no scientist and my results may not be an accurate representation of the product’s effects, but I just wanted to share our experience for other inquiring parents. On another note, I tried the gummies myself. They are delicious! I don’t doubt you will have any difficulty getting your kids to take these if you decide to do so.

review_text: I have a little 3.5 year old who slept like a dream until 9 months, but from that point forward, never wanted to sleep or nap. She's the third, so I guess she felt she was always missing something but it was getting really tiring having her up to 1030/11 each night, sometimes playing away, not napping during the day etc. I would be dragging her out of bed to change her for nursery school or driving my boys to elementary. Taking half of one of these a night, seems to do the trick and gets her to sleep before 930 and she wakes now on her own. She was always happy and in good spirits, but she looks really good in the morning now and well rested. They don't taste bad, in fact she really likes them. I am using them in 7-10 day spurts trying to get her to bed earlier and earlier until shes about going to bed when the boys are. Which is a goal I would be happy with. I am not going to push my luck with this one, but this product was recommended to me by one of her teachers and I am really glad to have tried it. Just a half seems to zonk her out.

review_text: I’ve lost so much sleep since my little one has been stuck home and unable to go to school in person. This gummy has helped me in getting him to sleep on time instead of sleeping at 1am night after night. I also noticed that he seems to have more energy and has been sleeping better, has less nightmares or sleep talking episodes or waking up half way through the night. He LOVES the flavor which is saying a lot cuz he normally doesn’t like many gummy flavors and looks forward to his “vitamin” each night. My recommendation: give this to your kiddo at least 30min before your ideal bed time. Create a comfortable space(if you put them in bed that’s even better) and maybe ready them a book. Whenever ever I have my kiddo in bed and then give him the gummy he knocked out within 5minutes. If I give it to him while he’s watching tv or distracted by something it takes longer for him to fall asleep because I know he’s fighting it A LOT. So def create the space for your child to rest and it will work perfectly, otherwise your kiddos will fight it as much as they can 😂

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: My 8 year old daughter had trouble sleeping early especially on school nights so upon reading the mostly decent reviews, decided to purchase this. The gummies had a pleasant smell but were overly and unnecessarily sweet especially if it is meant to be taken before bed time. I made sure to try it first and after much begging from my 4 year old, gave him one too. I had some stomach pain about an hour after, the kids felt fine. Everyone had 1 gummy as a trial. While my daughter was able to sleep through the night, my son and I were tossing and turning, waking up every hour or so. My son would sit up in bed with his eyes shut. That feeling when your body is asleep but your mind awake, that's what I felt. This morning my daughter mentioned feeling stomach pain at some point during the night. Knowing this product is marketed towards kids and experiencing these side effects first hand makes me uneasy. Never again.

review_text: My 4yr old was struggling with falling asleep at night. He's always been a great sleeper until recently. But once he falls asleep, he'd sleep a good solid 10-12hrs. So when he started staying up past midnight just tossing and turning in his bed, I decided to give these gummies a try. It was trial and error. I started off quartering the 1mg gummy and giving him just a ¼ of it. It would usually kick in within an hour/ hour and a half and he'd fall asleep, but then would wake up a few hours later and would be up the rest of the night. So I figured he was either getting too much melatonin or not enough. I then decided to try cutting the quarters (that I had already cut) in half! That did the trick! After taking this very small amount (about 0.12mg) he would pass out within 20-30mins and sleep soundly the WHOLE night!! Like magic! Less is more!! I would definitely recommend these, but start with less than 1mg and then figure out what works best!

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: For me, this product wasn’t a solution because even with a tiny amount I still had nausea and dizziness (and I’m a 125 pound adult). I’d say though that bc of the vertigo I had to stay in the same spot and tell myself to just go to sleep, which did work. So I guess it affects some people differently and YMMV. If the side effects happen for you and you don’t mind though, there is still sleep involved! I also noticed being somewhat sluggish the next day - “overcast” is the way I would describe it. Once I took a much larger dose from another brand and was very groggy for about 12 hours after waking up so you could say this was an improvement from that. However, I would prefer the effects to be over sooner. Guess I’m just too sensitive to melatonin in general.

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: Phenomenal product, but use caution you don't overdo it. We have an almost-5 year old that has always struggled a bit with settling down for bedtime and this worked wonders for him, but kids only need a fraction of one of these gummies to have the desired effect. Studies on melatonin suggest as little as 0.2 mg (one-fifth of one of these gummies) is efficacious for an adult; even less for a child. I can confirm - when I bought these the first night I took half of one and it knocked me out within 15 minutes. Giving our kids a teeny sliver of one of these is enough to do the same to them. Additionally, if they get too much, it can actually make it harder for them to fall asleep, and makes them groggy the next day as they have too much residual melatonin in their body. We love this product because it has less melatonin in it than other brands (harder to overdose), they're super tasty, and contains all-natural ingredients.

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count

review_text: I have been diagnosed with insomnia since I was a teenager, using things like Ambien and Lunesta for over a decade. product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: I bought these for my girlfriend because her two year old has limitless levels of energy, needs to sleep more and getting him to sleep can be a challenge. I'm sure you can relate. Just keep in mind that these aren't going to knock out your child in 15-20 minutes. Depending on the situation, it might have them sleeping in about an hour. So just plan ahead! Another thing to be mindful of, and this might just be specific to my girlfriend's child, but he gets grumpy when he's sleepy and this problem is exacerbated by the fact that he doesn't want to go to sleep. So in a strange way, these gummies are fighting directly with his will to stay awake and keep playing, which makes him even more grumpy. If we gave him a gummy and he wakes up in the middle of the night for whatever reason, he's usually a little whinier and grumpier than normal. Because of this, we'd rather have him go to sleep naturally, without using gummies. But sometimes, these gummies are a godsend! Especially when you want to be 100% SURE that they'll be asleep by a certain time. If you have a toddler, I'm sure you'll understand! Tip: Doing all the usual things to help them relax, wind down and get sleepy, like warm milk, a shower/bath, bedtime story, nightlight, etc. in combination with one of these gummies should work wonders! Bottomline: PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT! Feed them a gummy around one hour before you want them asleep. They will asleep and it will help them sleep but it also won't knock them out the way chloroform will, which is probably a good thing.
review_header: Takes a while to kick in

review_text: My 7 year old daughter has had issues falling asleep her whole life. Her occupational therapist and pediatrician had told me many times to give Melatonin a try. review_text: We're a fully neurodiverse family with two ADHD guys and one on the spectrum. Sometimes bed time is just... bumpy. For anxious or overwhelmed nights, we give the boys half a dose: 1 gummy for our 10 or 7 year old, half a gummy for our 5 year old. They work wonderfully. They calm them down so that they don't end up laying in bed fidgeting, crying, or stressing over falling asleep. Each child generally only needs one once every two weeks or once a week during really bumpy times, so I don't have any information on long term, consistent use. I would definitely recommend these as an occasional supplement for anxious kids, though. After all-- we all know the challenges are just harder when they're tired.

review_text: I tried this once for our child, and it worked great she was asleep in 20 minutes (normally an hour+ ordeal). But candidly, it made me not sleep as I was worried all night about side effects and felt guilty over using a quick fix. Also on the way to daycare the next day she said mommy I feel tired, which never comes out of her mouth. After much research it's evident that there has simply not been enough studies to say this is safe for long term use for children who are developing. review_text: I have a very energetic 2 year old but he’s 36 lbs so these are safe to give him. He thrives on routine and sleeps great once he actually falls asleep. Bedtime is always between 7-7:30 I noticed he was starting to have trouble acting FALLING Asleep. I changed his nap time to 12:30-2:30 instead of the 1:30-3:30 to see if waking him up an hour earlier would help. Not much of a difference so I decided to try these. I give him one gummy about 6:15-6:30 pm and we do our bath and bedtime story by 7:15 and now, since taking these gummy’s, he’s out like a light within 10 minutes of me leaving the room. These gummy’s worked the first night and every night since!! The only downside (to me anyway) is that he’s waking up earlier in the morning. He used to sleep till 9-9:30 am but since starting the gummy’s he’s getting such solid sleep that he’s up about 8 am. All in all, these gummy’s work AMAZING!! If your little one is having trouble falling asleep at bedtime, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND trying these gummy’s!! Just one gummy about 30-45 minutes before you want them to go to sleep and BOOM... out like a light!!

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: Update: Well this bottle of gummies were super hard unlike another bottle we ordered prior. Hoping this next bottle isn't like that. I wish they had the childrens in 3mg gummies so that I'm not having to buy a bottle every 6 weeks for two kids ugh. I try not to use every night but they say they need it frequently to go to sleep. Working well. Finally one was able to stay asleep all night againm I wish they had more in the bottle, and/or offered 2mg ones like they have 3mg ones. I have 4 kids and 3 of them needed this to help with sleep. I used it on two of my kids ages 11 and 13, it says two gummies for one and 3 for the other, although they are just 1 pound apart, not sure how the dosing works with melatonin, never used anything like this before. It didn't help first night. One had been up all night til like 4am, slept til 7pm I gave gummies at 11:30pm. Just didn't work at all. Next night struggled keeping awake all day but gave gummies at 11pm and was asleep by 11:20pm. So it seems these help when the child has not napped at all during the day. They don't help keep the child asleep. My child when they worked second night woke up at 5am ugh. This makes it difficult to keep the child up without a nap and have the gummies work. The oldest one it helps fall asleep he says but only if he is laying down within 30 mins of taking them. If he has to use the bathroom or anything they don't work at all. Both have Autism, and never had sleep issues til recently with everything going on pandemic wise and some deaths we had. I have heard people suggest melatonin to help with sleep issues like this, so I figured out of desperation I would try. I'm not sure if it's this brand or what, but I'm trying it out for a while longer to see.

review_text: These are great. I love that they are only 1 mg. I have 3.5 year old twins and when they get off schedule staying up too late for several nights, or vacation, or sickness, etc, it can be really hard to get them back on track to normal bedtime hours. I cut these into fourths and give them as needed and they work great. I don’t use them all the time but just here and there when needed and it helps get them back on track. I also use them for my 10 year old son. He’s always had a difficult time falling asleep..he is mildly adhd and his mind has always raced at night. Most nights he uses 2 gummies and it helps him a lot, when he takes them it takes about 20-30 minutes but he’s able to fall asleep and doesn’t end up lying awake in bed for hours frustrated and tired like he used to. I’m going to try to move down to 1 gummy and see if that still works, and hoping to wean off altogether eventually. But if not it’s so little melatonin my pediatrician says it’s totally fine if it’s helping him get better sleep, which it is. Glad to have found these!

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: Gave to my twin 4 yo girls for only two nights. In the past we've tried liquid melatonin on occasion but it never seemed to help. Friends swore by these gummies so I wanted to give em a try. My girls sleep thru the night without issue and aren't early risers. But they can take upwards of 2 hours to fall asleep once in bed. Night one we gave to them 60 min before bedtime. It helped a lil but didn't seem to be any sort of miracle. They still took the same fusing and about an hour to fall asleep. One was very restless and upset because I think it made her very tired and over-emotional. She had trouble settling herself. Later in the night she was tossing and turning and half awake crying. She seemed uncomfortable but stayed asleep. Night two we followed the same routine and they once again fell asleep at about 9pm (not terrible but still not early enough). This night my other daughter started waking at 11pm and was in a lot of discomfort. It seemed like her stomach was hurting and she was having nightmares. She wouldn't wake fully and couldn't clearly communicate what was wrong. But it was obvious she was in distress - she kept curling up in what looked like stomach pain and moving all around. She was also muttering and half crying like she was having a bad dream. I stayed with her most the night and this continual tossing, writhing, and cries continued until 3am. At that point she woke and complained of a bad taste, wanted to keep spitting in the bathroom sink. Then she returned to bed and was WIDE awake and rambling like a runaway train. Her brain was in overdrive and she probably didn't settle until 4:30am. She woke with the same complaint of the bad taste and wanting to spit it - water and tooth brushing didn't seem to help. She was also really emotional and exhausted (no surprise). I think for her body this synthetic hormone does not work and only caused side effects. She did say her stomach hurt and she was having bad dreams. She was reluctant to eat and I think her stomach was still unsettled. She just kept asking for something to drink. These didn't work at all and just caused too many side effects in just two nights of taking them. Definitely will NOT use again.
review_header: Will not use again - Only bad side effects

review_text: A miracle! For the first time since weaning her, my 3 year old is able to be still and quiet as she drifts off to sleep. Her neurologist recommended melatonin to help my daughter relax and go to sleep peacefully. She has an involuntary movement disorder and physically can't be still and relax. I also give her B12 and magnesium, but it was the melatonin that really did it! I give her half at naptime and half at bedtime. Today I gave it to her before we swam. She swam for 20 minutes and played for about 10 minutes in her playroom. Went to the soft corner of her playroom to get "cozy". I pleasantly got her to go to her bed instead and she laid down and for the first time, closed her eyes and was still and quiet as we cuddled up and she fell asleep within 10 minutes. So 50 minutes after giving it to her. I have longed for the moment to have my sweet baby girl cuddle up next to me and fall asleep!! This is priceless!!

review_text: We have tried everything under the sun to help my 12yr old ADHD kid settle at bedtime and go to sleep. Nothing ever seemed to help him get to sleep or stay asleep. product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: My seven year old son with ADHD and night terrors is finally going to sleep in peace. These gummies have been a complete game-changer for him. He only needs one and within 30 minutes, he's asking to go to bed. Prior to this, he would often stay up for another hour after an hour long bedtime process of brushing teeth, reading books, listening to relaxing music or children's meditation stories, long tuck-ins, a thousand questions, etc. Once he finally got to sleep, he would wake up with night terrors and run from room to room screaming and jumping. His dad and I would have to protect him and his younger brother until it would subside. It was awful. Last week, my son actually came to me and asked if there's anything he could take that would help him sleep, so we bought these. I am in complete amazement. He's getting the best sleep of his life and everyone else is too. As a result of going to bed at a reasonable time, he wakes up at a reasonable time and seems refreshed from a good night's sleep. This is a child who is adamantly opposed to medication of any kind no matter how sick he may be, but I think even he is relieved to be able to get to bed without a two hour battle of restless boredom followed by crazed lunacy in the night. If I could give this product ten stars, I would.
review_header: Life-altering for ADHD and night terrors

review_text: I think this is a great product for kids that can tolerate melatonin. I know some kids that do great with these, but they didn't work for our son. We started giving these to our 3 1/2 year old when he was having a hard time settling into sleep. They helped him fall asleep much quicker, which was great. Then he started waking at 10 pm periodically with night terrors. Or he would wake at 2 am and it would take us hours to get him back to sleep. After checking some of the one star reviews on here, I made the connection that it was the supplements. We stopped, and haven't had an issue since. So I would just say pay attention to how your child reacts to them.
review_header: Helped initially, but then came the night terrors.

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: I never review stuff I buy on Amazon, but after the experience me and my 5 year old had last night with these sleep gummies, I felt compelled to. Gave her 2 gummies, within 20 minutes she was out cold. Maybe a half hour later, she shot up like a dart and started talking complete nonsense. I chalked it up to "she's dreaming, no big deal." But it happened again and again over the course of an hour. Her face went white as a sheet, she was visibly shaking, her teeth were chattering and she looked terrified. One of the scariest experiences of my life as a mother. After a few hours, she fell back asleep and now, the next morning, has no memory of any of it. I should have done my homework and read other similar reviews about this product. I'm still shaken up from the experience. I will NEVER give these to my kid, or any kid, again.

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: I have struggled immensely with the concept of giving my four year old melatonin. I thought it was harsh, ridiculous, and unnecessary. However, I have continuously had an issue regardless of nap/no nap, bedtime routine, anything. I decided to give this a try, only on nights where she has school the next morning or some other intensive activity. I gave my daughter one tonight at 8:30 after bathtime, did our night routine, let her play for a few minutes, and she was out by 9:30. Sometimes she will be up until 11pm or later, so I would say this absolutely worked. I was so skeptical but I approve! I hope this gives her mind some rest and allows her to cope with frustrations throughout the day. (UPDATE #2) I went the next night without giving it to her. We had our normal day of activity, bath time, bedtime routine, and lights out. She finally went to sleep maybe three hours later, which has become the painful norm. I gave it to her again tonight, right after her bath, so she could relax getting ready for bed. She could hardly read she was so tired and was so fussy. She was out within 45 minutes of taking it. I want to look into this further because I would hope people are not utilizing this in an incorrect way, but I worry about my daughters min just racing all the time, like a lot of intelligent childrens do, which can lead to many problems later. If this can give her a little mental break every now and again where she can truly be refreshed and energized, I will be so happy. I hate when she is tired, angry, frustrated, and not herself due to lack of sleep.

review_text: PLEASE PLEASE CUT THEM DOWN AND TEST before you just give your child a whole gummy ... read on ... I was so thankful to see a child’s version of melatonin! My boy is 7. I bought the 1mg gummies BUT I took them all out and cut them into 1/4’s & 1/8th’s of the gummy. I put them back in the bottle and it works out because the sugary substance still separates them. I give my son a 1/4 or an 1/8 of a 1 mg gummy and he gets sleepyhead soon. I do feel guilty most nights however the stinker just doesn’t ‘chill out’ until it’s really really late. Ah 🤦‍♀️. I do make sure that when I decide to give him this that it’s close to night night time because he’s usually so sleepy after vitamins. It’s a good sleepy though. Just make sure you’re texting. Again ... PLEASE PLEASE CUT THEM DOWN AND TEST before you just give your child a whole gummy! Some kiddos might need the whole thing but my son does fine on an 1/8th of a piece that I cut down. product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: This has helped my 5 yr old tremendously! We have tried the nursing to sleep method, the Ferber method, and the gentle training method over the last few years. We do a short bed time routine with a soft music playing that he loves, and a humidifier/essential oil dispenser with lavender oil in it. We have had a set routine since he was a few weeks old and this child STILL would fight sleep for two hours(not exaggerating) every night. Baby sitters would comment and family members(with good intentions) would offer suggestions. We would let them try to help and even they were bemused. Finally, after realizing that I as a child had the same problem, I researched the best herbal ideas. I was hesitant to use melatonin, because of the side effects that are associated with using melatonin. We started to see the lack of sleep effect his mood the older he got, AND he was starting school so he needed help. We got the go ahead from our pediatrician, and finally found this kid friendly gummie with melatonin AND no alcohol(score!). We started with only half a gummie, and have seen a HUGE difference. It only takes him about 15-20 min to fall asleep now when we give this to him 20 min before bedtime. We don’t use it every night, and the nights we don’t it takes him 30 min- 1 hr to fall asleep. We don’t want him to become dependant on it so we don’t use it EVERY night. We can now put the kids to bed, and not be trying to keep him in his room till 9:30 or later!

review_text: I am giving this a one star review because the bottles are not child proof. It says that they are, but they are not. We even purchased this same product from Walmart and had the same result. If you twist the lid back and forth a couple of times, then it will just come off. My son was trying to be helpful and take his sleeping gummies by himself, and opened the bottle. He took several. Thankfully it didn’t harm him because it’s such a low dose in each gummy and the ingredients are all natural. We did deal with the situation with our son. Even though he disobeyed he still should not of been able to get the lid off. The lid issue applies for these gummies, and also for the chewable tablets as well. Both types of bottles were easily opened by a child. Aside from the bottle safety issue, the product is good. It does help him fall asleep and stay asleep. We will continue to use them but have them stored in a different type of container now.

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: I started giving this to my kindergartener, but it would knock him out only to find him wide awake in the middle of the night, sometimes due to nightmares. More importantly: “Earlier this year (2015), sleep researchers at the University of Adelaide in Australia warned doctors and parents not to provide melatonin to kids for sleep problems. In a paper published in the Journal of Paediatrics and Child Health in February, authored by professor David Kennaway, who has studied melatonin for 40 years, Kennaway cautioned that use of the supplement in kids may result in serious side effects when the children are older. "The use of melatonin as a drug for the treatment of sleep disorders for children is increasing and this is rather alarming," Kennaway said in a statement. He noted in the paper that there's extensive evidence from animal and human studies that the supplement causes changes in physiological systems, including the reproductive, cardiovascular, immune and metabolic systems. "The word 'safe' is used very freely and loosely with this drug, but there have been no rigorous, long-term safety studies of the use of melatonin to treat sleep disorders in children and adolescents."
review_header: May pose risks for kids’ development long-term

review_text: UPDATE: Our youngest started having trouble after using these for 2-months. They would help him get to sleep, but the slightest noise would wake him up and he couldn't go back to sleep. ORIGINAL: Our sons have had trouble sleeping ever since the lockdown went into effect a year ago. On certain nights during the school year, they had great trouble falling asleep due to anxiety. review_text: I gave HALF a gummy to my toddler just to try it out before we go on a vacation. He is a good sleeper normally, but takes 2-3 hours to fall asleep on vacation even after an exhausting and activity filled day. So glad I tried it out ahead of vacation because it made my normal good sleeper wake up at 5am (as opposed to his normal 8-9am). He was vomiting and had a headache. This, along with red eyes, tummy ache, and warm body experiencing chills, lasted all day and into the next. I researched melatonin- wow!! I feel like a terrible mom for not researching before I gave him HALF a gummy!! Melatonin should NOT be a product just on the “shelf” to purchase. It is incredibly easy to overdose on this stuff! It must be an Rx! And I only have my child 1/2 a gummy! If I would have given him the whole thing, his side effects would be even greater… which can include swollen throat and difficulty breathing and seizures! Not to mention long terms effects to the psychological system, reproductive system, and glands! Oh my goodness- DO NOT BUY!

review_text: I gave this to my 10 year old son who has trouble falling asleep. This made him extremely nauseous, which kept him up later than usual and when he finally did fall asleep he had a horrific vivid nightmare; my son never has nightmares. After some research, I learned that the side effects of melatonin include nausea, headaches, daytime grogginess, dizziness, stomach cramping, short term depression and irritability. It’s also worth noting that it may increase risk of seizures, interfere with hormones during adolescence, raise blood pressure in individuals on medication to control it and raise blood sugar. Source: webmd.

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: From the time my son was 3 months old he struggled with sleep. I have 5 kids. He is the only one I ever had difficulty with. He has bad eczema and it would keep him awake. He'd wake up and cry for bandaids. Lotion. The doctor prescribed a higher strength version of Benadryl for bedtime. Those were the only times I was ever brought peace. But still, sleeping through the night for him and myself was a rare occasion. He also had a million quirks, he would need his blanket fixed, his McQueen car, change his shirt.. you name it. I was in and out of his room 3-5x a night. Now he's reached an age, if he takes his nap at all and especially if it's late, he's up until midnight. Being out of a crib added to the stress but he's 3 now and climbed out a long time ago. Long story short, since he finally turned 3 I started using the melatonin. Different. Kid. The first few nights I thought it was my imagination but he was out within 10 minutes. But it's been a few months now and bedtime routine is quick. Easy. I'm not in and out every 5 seconds "what do you need now?" He wakes up in the middle of the night every once in a while but I can't blame him. It's winter and his eczema is at its worst this time of the year. But it's a simple, apply lotion and back to bed. Naps are the same. I don't use melatonin for his naps but he goes right down to sleep. It was previously a huge headache getting him to cooperate. His behavior during the daytime has changed too. This could be attributed to the better sleep regime or because he's finally no longer two. Either way, his tantrums (and he has violent worrisome tantrums) have lessened. He's happier. Nicer. So much more enjoyable to be around. I try to keep the melatonin to a minimum of course but it has IMO helped sooo immensely. I use it for my 4 year old as well who has always been a great sleeper on his own. but when hes napped, now we have the same issue with him being up too late at night. We're trying to phase out naps for him but we are out in the car every night so it's either nap at noon with your brother or fall asleep in the car at 5 and be up all night. We have a long international flight in the spring and I'm actually thinking I can get my boys to sleep most of the way! I never thought melatonin would truly be the answer But so far it has.

review_text: I usually buy these at Target for the same price, and felt I needed to review. I'm mom of 3 and these little gummies have made nighttime a breeze for me! I've never had super unruly kids who refuse to go sleep, I just have the ones that lay in bed talking and laughing until someone falls asleep first, that's my nightmare. Got these on a whim and they've been amazing! My 6 y/o is knocked out in less than 30 min and my 8 y/o tells me he's ready for bed on his own! I struggle sleeping as well, and take 5mg melatonin that makes me feel extremely groggy and super pissy the next morning. Decided to take one of these just because and man, I take one every night now; the 1mg in there worked A LOT better than the 5mg I was taking. Granted they're coated with what I consider too much sugar, it's a small price to pay to get a good night sleep. I'm on a third bottle and no one in my family has reported night terrors, or headaches. Love these, and will for sure keep buying!

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: This is a product worth it's weight in gold for parents struggling to get a hyperactive child to bed. We have used this for several months and then suddenly when school started, couldn't find it ANYWHERE locally. Tired of one more thing being added to the out-of-stock, supply-chain-issue-list, we turned to Amazon. It was a little more expensive, but worth putting it on subscription for automatic delivery and not having to search all over town for it next month. My granddaughter was 5 when we first started using it. It was a battle every night getting her little ADHD body to settle down for sleep and not get out of bed 5X because she "hated sleep". We started by cutting the gummies in half and as she grew and turned 6, increased it to a whole one. It's not to say she sleeps through every night, or sleeps in, in the mornings...she's still up at 5:30a most mornings and has nights where she wakes up at 2a or 3a wanting a drink or a snack - depending on how much physical energy was expended during the day, BUT at least everyone can go to bed on a happy note and get some much needed rest. Oh, and she's a pretty picky eater, but LIKES the TASTE! The only thing better would be a time-released version that lasted all night, but I don't think that's available in a children's formula.
review_header: Helps my ADHD granddaughter get to sleep FAST

review_text: My son has always been a terrible sleeper. Since day 1. I did try pure melatonin back during his terrible two's and although it worked in theory, he woke up grumpy and disoriented. The last thing I wanted to go back to was melatonin...but guess what.? 6:30am comes quick and during school year the schedule is like clockwork! I wanted to make sure he gets enough sleep and he generally wouldn't fall asleep until 9:30, sometimes 10pm. I ordered Zarbee's on Amazon but missed the 1 day shipping and because I am super impatient, while waiting for my delivery I did go to the drug store and got the Vicks brand (Pure Zsss). That night, my kiddo did fall asleep very quickly BUT he woke up with nightmares and was so groggy the next morning, he could barely function. I was so mad at myself and said NEVER AGAIN. I tossed the whole bottle in the trash. When Zarbee's came I was super hesitant. I gave him a gummy before bed. We brushed teeth, and read a book. 30 min later he was out like a light. review_text: My 5 yr old child would stay up late then be a bit grumpy when I had to wake him up in the morning. I thought this would get him on a more "traditional" schedule. So I gave them a whirl. Gummies themselves: Worked within 30 minutes. Gave them to my son at 730pm and he would be snoring by 8pm. (I only gave him 1/2) He enjoyed them. 0 struggle getting him to eat it. Why the 3 stars: It did what they said they would do. They got my son to sleep fast and at a decent hour. However my son had a negative reaction to the gummies. His behaviors had took a drastic turn. He began regressing socially at the daycare where I work. I believe he was showing signs of being drowsy and having headaches. Stopped giving him the gummies. product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: I was hesitant to give my kid sleeping supplements because kids should be capable of falling asleep on their own, and if they can't, their issue may need more investigation by their pediatrician. That said, many of the other medical professionals that I work with would talk about how they'd give their kids melatonin to get them to sleep at night, and this sort of motivated me to look into it for my own 8 year old. He likes to stay up late, unbeknownst to Mom and Dad, which means he's hard to get up in the morning, is super grouchy, and suffers in paying attention in class. After hearing my coworkers, I decided to give melatonin a try, at least once, and since Zarbees had such great reviews, I bought it to give it a try. I struggle with sleep also thanks to some meds I take, so every night I have to take melatonin, and knowing that different doses have affected me differently, I only gave my son 1 gummy instead of 2 the first night. Of course, it didn't really work, so the next night we did the 2 that the bottle suggests, and sure enough, that boy put down the TV remote, walked himself into bed, and put himself in his covers because he was so tired... He's never done anything like that! And the next morning, he woke himself up and was so pleasant and ready to get to school, all because he was well rested. Now, every night, he reminds me that we both have to take our sleeping pills (lol), and since I know regular melatonin use is safe (it is a hormone your body produces naturally anyhow), it's a routine we'll probably be doing every night.

review_text: We have twin 4 year olds and a 5 year old. It didn't seem to matter what we tried to get them to wind down at night. We would ride bikes for miles, no naps, dimmer lights, baths, lavender essential oils.... They just wouldn't go to sleep until 11pm, even midnight some nights. It was making things difficult for hubby and I to get our own time, and get the proper rest. We found these at our local vitamin shop and it revolutionized our bedtime routine! We give them each one gummy after dinner, read a book, baths, and then they actually go to bed!! I'm a little hesitant to use it every night because I don't want their little bodies to become dependent on an outside source for melatonin, but it really helps for those nights that they just don't wind down. It's amazing, they love them!!

review_text: Look, we didn't want to resort to this, I'm happy we gave it the chance. Some nights our 3 yr old just can not sleep. Like making us crazy close to midnight and he's still going strong. I don't get it. He's just a very active child. And on those "some nights" lol we now have a little gummy to help us out. No lie 10 to 15 min and he's sound asleep. Sometimes he wakes up to see where mommy's at, but definitely no fuss in getting him right back to sleep. If your considering it, do it. I felt bad the first night like I was a bad parent. The next day not so much. We've had this bottle for about a month and a half now, and have used it maybe 4 times. And when the bottle finally runs out, we will absolutely purchase it again with no shame. It worked for our boy, and it was honestly a 50/50 chance it would. Cause melatonin has no affect on mom, and dad it knocks him out like a light. Mom can take 50mg and nothing will happen, dad only needs 10mg lol. But thankful he has his dad's genes on that one.. anyhow that's a long review with lots of background info. Some kids have different reactions to stuff and there's never any shame in consulting the pediatrician either. It's all natural anyways. Best of luck to you parents, hope your kid gets some sleep, why else would you be here "winky face" lol

review_text: I bought these mostly for that one kid who has a hard time going to sleep at a decent hour, but all three children tried them on Friday night. The 3 yr old took 1, fell asleep within 25 minutes. Slept so good throughout the night, she didn’t get up to use the bathroom & she wet the bed. (Good thing she wasn’t the one that needed them & no, she will not be using this product!) The 4 yr old took 1 & fell asleep within minutes. The 6 yr old took two, as recommended, and he did not go to sleep for 2 hours. (He’s the one who has trouble going to bed) So we tried it again Saturday night (6yr), he fell asleep within an hour. Maybe it worked, maybe he was just tired. Monday night around 10pm the 6 yr old kid wasn’t asleep so he wanted to take some “sleep potion”, they didn’t work. So I’ll say this product is a toss up like most products. It might work for some, but not all.

review_text: As far as the product goes, it works great! My little one drifted off to a restful sleep and woke up happy. Unfortunately, we didn't know that melatonin can exacerbate asthma symptoms. I started giving him the melatonin and the following happened: the first days he felt sleep after about 15-20 min of taking the gummy and he was waking up during the night restless. He wanted to play, eat, etc.. You know the story. But I was not convinced that is was a side effect because melatonin is produced for our body. We continue giving him one gummy a day. And after 4 days his body was used to fall sleep and he continue to sleep well during the night. The big positive difference was during the day, because he can focused better and is less grumpy. So.. yes. it can happen that the kid has a side effect during the first days but he later will hopefully sleep throughout the night. I guess some bodies need to adjust to the new time for sleep.

review_text: Purchasing this made me wish I wasn't one who stocks up on some things so I have it when needed. I ordered this in April 2019 but didn't open it till July 19, 2019. Before then, it was never opened. When I took the lid off there was a hole in the seal that was the size of a finger. I asked everyone in my family and no touched it. Our kids didn't even know where it was and since this is a children's one, my husband didn't touch it. The first thing that came to thought was someone opened it, didn't like it and returned it and it wasn't checked by Amazon to see if it was open. There was no plastic on the outside of the lid either, which we know a lot of companies don't do. This product has some great reviews, but makes me a little hesitant to order it again or see if the store by us has it

review_text: Our son has had issues sleeping since birth. From reflux to constant ear infections to chicken pox, he never got to settle into a healthy sleeping pattern. He’s also extremely active and almost hyper compared to our other son. No matter what we did for our bedtime routine, he would fight it like a Roman gladiator. He doesn’t “calm down” for stories or massage. He just goes and goes until he literally crashes. And after crashing, he was so overtired that he would have very restless sleep with frequent wakings. One of these gummies has him ASKING to go to bed within twenty to thirty minutes. He doesn’t take one every night - just when he seems too wound up to calm down for a normal bedtime. I can not recommend these highly enough. They’ve made a huge difference in sleep quality for ALL of us now that his isn’t staying wired until 1am and tossing and turning all night.

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: I was very excited to get these for my son. He’s five years old and autistic, so we have a very hard time getting him to sleep. He constantly wakes up and comes into our room after we finally get him to sleep. We gave him the gummy (he loves gummies) and he immediately spit it out. He fought us for so long and refused to eat it. He takes other vitamins and elderberry gummies, so I was confused why he refused these. I ended up trying one myself and they’re horrible! No wonder he doesn’t like them. After almost 30 minutes of convincing him to eat one (we had to bribe him), he finally took the gummy. It took roughly 30 minutes for him to unwind, but he actually stayed in bed and fell asleep rather quickly. We were so excited, until he woke up 2 hours later and came into our room. The next night we tried again and after a big struggle, he ate a gummy again. However, this time he didn’t stay in his room. Although it didn’t take over an hour to get him to sleep, it took almost 45 minutes. And again, he woke up and came into our bed. So it seems like the fight to get him to take these may not be worth it. Now we’re going to have to look for other options and maybe give a higher dose.
review_header: Taste awful and didn’t work as well as I expected.

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: I’ve tried different melatonin gummy products over the years and never found any that passed all three tests....effectiveness, taste, no side effects. Either they didn’t work at all, were awful taste-wise, or caused some side effects I wasn’t comfortable with. I got to the point of desperation, having 2 of my 3 children finding it next to impossible to settle down to sleep at night (9yo & 4yo). They could lay in bed for hours restless with no stimulation going (ex no tv, music, etc) and still have trouble falling asleep. After multiple nights of the same problem, I caved and started to research. A little background: both kids would lie down around 8:30-9, and not fall asleep until after midnight. They would also wake up early and had no naps. What I can tell you about these (after at least 10 days use): 1. My kids tolerate the taste. My 4yo finds them better tasting than my 9yo but neither are necessarily excited about eating them. However, they aren’t “gross” as they say and they don’t fight me on them. 2. The first night I gave them both one each, they were asleep within 30 mins. I gave them one early thinking it would take at least one hour to work (like other brands in the past) but nope they were out. I figured maybe it was either a lucky night OR maybe they convinced themselves the gummy worked and didn’t “fight” it. But then it happened night after night, within 30 mins of taking it they were out. This happened while watching a movie or their iPad/iPhone, and in their beds with nothing on (trust me, I experimented to see if it made a difference). 3. By the 5th or 6th night my 9yo began staying up past her brother and was showing signs of frustration bc she couldn’t get to sleep as easily. I gave her 2 (her dosage on the bottle) for 1-2 nights and she was right back to falling asleep within 30 mins. She has since been bumped back down to 1 but on the off chance it doesn’t work I will give her another one. 4. They both stay asleep through the night and wake up better rested in the AM. I didn’t have as much trouble with my oldest (sleeping through night) BUT she always woke up really groggy and hard to get moving. Now they both wake up seeming to have gotten a true full nights sleep. 5. No side effects that I have seen so far. I tested out one specific issue I’ve had with other brands and luckily this didn’t cause it. That issue being knocking them out to the point they couldn’t be woken up with “force”. I never want my kids to be “drugged up” to the point they can’t be woken up in an emergency situation. I was able to wake them both up (3 separate nights) by simply shaking them or yelling their name loudly. They also were able to immediately go back to sleep as well. I know some parents are reluctant about giving their children melatonin and some may even feel guilty (or have been shamed) for even thinking about giving your kid something to “force” sleep on them. But remember, you know your children better than anyone. If your child needs something natural to help them fall asleep than give them that, bc it will improve other areas you didn’t even realize were being affected by their lack of rest. These gummys are 1mg/ea which is a perfectly safe amount of children.

review_text: I was pretty skeptical about this working for my little 3 yo Chaos bringer. She's an energy drink human incarnate. Even when she was a baby this kid never slept solidly. It's finally gotten to the point where I just can't stay up all night and all day anymore. We're both in terrible moods all the time and just overall not the best version of ourselves without a consistent sleep schedule. Tried her first gummy last night. Was super wary of it working well because my husband thought it was a good idea for us all to get ice cream at 8pm at night 🙃 but let me tell you it works! Gave her one gummy at 9:30 by ten she told me she was tired. Got her ready and settled in bed without a fuss 😮. Homegirl was asleep by ten thirty 🙌. Slept the whole night! Like guys I went and checked on her through the night to make sure she was still breathing cause I've never had her sleep so hard and soundly. Now that she's up and around she's just as peppy and wild as usual. So no after effects whatsoever! Can't wait for us to all to get better rest! Definitely will be buying more in the future! To the parents of the little wonderful crazy pants in our lives that have more energy then a pack of wild hyenas and can't seem to shut down, do yourself a favor and try this product. You won't be disappointed.

product_title: Zarbee's Kids 1mg Melatonin Gummy, Drug-Free & Effective Sleep Supplement for Children Ages 3 and Up, Natural Berry Flavored Gummies, 50 Count
review_text: These things have saved my toddlers sleep. She hit the 2 year sleep regression hard, and suddenly could not calm down for sleep for anything. She was getting physically agressive toward us, hitting and kicking, when we tried to stick to our routine and bring her back to her room. She just couldn’t calm down and she would spiral, every night for more than 2 months. Finally we added these. Lifesaver. Or I should say, sleep saver. Huge difference. We only need to give her half, at the beginning of our bedtime routine. By the time we are done reading her book she is drowsy enough that she doesn’t fight sleep. Only complaint is the child proof lid is unlike any other bottle we have in this house. In theory it’s the same. Push down and twist. But this sucker does not like to budge. My husband and I both struggle with it every night, every bottle (we have it set up on subscription.) This last bottle is so bad that I’m going to be trying a different brand. It gets harder each time we open it. Like the plastic is wearing out or something, and since we split the gummies in half, this bottle lasts us twice as long and it’s just a beast to open by the end. I’m tempted to leave it open, but of course that isn’t safe around children at all. Love the gummy, hate the bottle.
